page.title: 16Royal Veterinary College
page.content: The College, which is part of the University of London, began in 1791, receiving its royal charter in 1875; faculty of Medicine in 1949,and site in Hertfordshire in 1955. Extensive buildings occupy land among arable and ley grass fields, which supply food to the stock on the farm of the College. Studies include animal management and husbandry; clinical work; medicine surgery; obstetrics; pharmacology and mea inspection. Royal involvement with the College still continues and a new referral animal hospital is planned, costing 2 million pounds. Further equine facilities and an aviary are also in hand, costing half a million pounds.
